That’s the fourteenth caution this aftern What’s the record at Phoenix, you recall? NED JARRETT V.O. I don’t know, Benny. But I believe we’ll find out what it by the end of the race.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: All right, while we’re still under a caution I want you to go back out on that track and hit the pace car. Hit the pace car.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Go on, go, go, go! He jumps back out, grumbling and cussing and doesn’t even bother to see Cole shoved back into the fray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: high above the race track, with endless miles of. traffic fans make their way to a beautiful speedway. NED JARRETT V.0. Welcome racing fans to Talladega, the home of the famed Alabama International Motor Speedway for the start of the Winston 500 -

dialogues.speaker: IN MID RACE
dialogues.text: Cole with his car in fairly good condition, tries to take Rowdy on the outside. HARRY’S VOICE (on radio) - you’re goin’ too high, stay in the groove -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the turn Rowdy nudges Cole. Cole promptly careens up into the wall hitting it front and back. He spins to a st with four flat tires. Harry turns and kicks a gas can across the pit.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FINISH LINE, (ANOTHER RACE)
dialogues.text: the checkered flag is dropped. BOB JENKINS V.0. - and Rowdy Burns has just won the Coca Cola here at the Charlotte Motor Speedway -

dialogues.speaker: IN PIT LANE 50
dialogues.text: It’s after the race. The crew goes over Cole’s - once again - completely battered car. Cole, pretty beat up himself, watches one of the crew members spot a side pane that isn’t damaged.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: How about that? We got a side we don’t have to work out. Harry promptly kicks in the side panel.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t want you spoiled, Benny. Harry spits at Cole’s feet and walks off. Cole is furious

dialogues.speaker: FROM PIT TO PIT
dialogues.text: Harry and his over-the-wall gang watch one calamity after another. Daland is there on occasion to share their mount misery: 1. At Michigan the field of forty sits becalmed under a red flag. Cole looks thoroughly disgusted, but he’s near the front of the pack. HARRY’S VOICE (on radio) Now you’re settin’ pretty good - but on the restart I want you go get some heat in that engine before they throw the green, you copy? On the restart other drivers are gunning their engines behind the pace car. Cole does not. The green flag drops. Cole guns it, surges to the front - and blows his engine right through the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2. At Dover Cole hits the wall - of his own pit. His over-the-wall gang scatter and dive for safety. Harry looks up from behind the wall - fuming.

dialogues.speaker: EXT RACE TRACK DAY
dialogues.text: Cole is running in the middle of the pack. He notices the gauges on the dash fluctuating. He pushes the button.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~ I’m running hot. I gotta pit. HARRY’S VOICE - I don’t think so. We’re busy now.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You’re what? HARRY’S VOICE We're eatin’ ice cream - Cole glances out his window and glimpses his crew.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PIT ROAD DAY
dialogues.text: Sure enough they‘re eating ice cream cones. Harry and the crew sit in the deck chairs and munch away. Harry waves t Cole as he goes past.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE
dialogues.text: can’t believe what he’s seen. He nearly hits another driv who swerves and gives him the finger. HARRY’S VOICE - now you’re welcome to come on in and get one yourself, but I don’t believe Nascar would think much of you trying to eat an ice cream cone out there. You have enough trouble ridin’ around the track as it is -

dialogues.speaker: EXT PIT ROAD COLE
dialogues.text: zooms on into the lane and scrambles out of the car. He leaps the wall and goes after Harry, getting tangled up w deck chairs, smeared with ice cream, and being restrained crew.

dialogues.speaker: INT CITY CHEVROLET, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Daland, exceptionally well dressed in a dark suit, presid over his racing team’s meeting which includes the entire crew. It’s in a little coffee shop off the service area. Tensions are high. Harry and Cole are on opposite sides o the formica table, mustard and ketchup containers between them. 53 54 55 56 57

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: We messed up big time on Sunday. I had sponsors in the stands, I’m huggin’ and holdin’ hands and kissin’ ‘em in the ear and prayin’ for a good showing and what do we do? We end up looking like a monkey fucking a football out there. Everybody out please! except for you two. The team leaves. Harry and Cole stay behind - silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: {almost casual) I’ve got a question. What’s the one thing you absolutely need to do to win a race? Harry starts to answer.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: You keep quiet! Daland turns to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: You need to finish the race.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (to Daland) It would help to have a car that didn’t blow engines.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (to Daland) - if he wouldn’t get excited and over rev the sumbitch the engine wouldn’t blow! (with elaborate sarcasm) - now Cole when you shift the gear and that little needle on the tac goes into the red and reads 9000 rpm, that’s bad.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (to Daland) It’s also my fault the tires blow - if you ask this old fart.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hell yes it’s your fault. There’s forty other vultures out there who manage to finish the race on their tires. You don’t see Darryll Waltrip usin’ up his tires -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i Ob ee

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (flaring) There‘s nothin’ I can’t do with a race car!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well that’s the difference between you and me. There’s only so much I can do.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Harry he doedn't have to appreciate your job to do his.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He sure as hell does! how can he expect to race if he don’t know what a race car can and can’t do?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What is this shit? you want me to work the pit and you drive? fine we'll try that - Cole storms out into the used car lot. Harry is a little worried to be altogether surly.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: So he’s been trying too hard. What would you prefer Harry? That he not try hard enough? Harry glances uneasily over at Daland.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I can’t talk to the sumbitch.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Think he can drive? Harry turns and paces angrily.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh he can drive. He can drive beyond the limits of the tires, the engine, the car or anything else - (he supresses a belch) - if the sumbitch’d listen to me, we wouldn’t hardly ever lose a race. Daland sighs, looks out the window to see his wife and children waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: I gotta get goin’. Lauren’s about to take my head off. He doesn’t move. He looks miserable.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You know Tim, you sacrifice everything for racing. You can bite around the edges of it of course, but if you’re really gonna be involved you gotta be ready to give up everything and maybey you’re not ready to do that.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: I’m not involved, Harry, I’m committed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How’s that?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: It’s like the good old boy says. If you sit down to breakfast tomorrow to bacon and eggs the chicken is involved, the pig is committed. If we don’t get us a sponsor in the next coupla 1 races my ass is fried, I’m liable to be out of the car business altogether - and Harry. I know you/re great, you know your great but if the guy in the car doedn’t trust you we’ll never wina single race. (DAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole watches one of Tim’s salesmen selling a truck. He’s the hood up and is pointing out engine features to a seri buyer. Harry into SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: All right Harry, talk ~

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: On the radio, during the race. You wanna run right on the ragged edge all the damn time, you gotta tell me what’s goin’ on with the car -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You just want to change the way I drive it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Maybe you could set the car up so I don’t have to change.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’d be happy to - (almost shouting) ~ you just tell me how. This gets to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 oe eee He  Nov 20 1989.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hell, Cole, you’re the driver. If you think she’s runnin’ loose or soft, tell us, we give a turn here, take some wedge out there, we’ll win some races. That’s all there is to it.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why the hell not?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (turns to him) Because I don’t know what the fuck you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (puzzled) How do you mean that? Cole looks around. Harry looks around.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (lowering his voice) - I don’t know much about cars, okay?..

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (brightiy) Hey Cole, that don’t make you a damn bit different from any driver I ever met.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (furious) - I mean I really don’t know. I don’t know what you just said about turn here and wedge there. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (a moment, then:) How’d that happen?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What the fuck’s the difference, they just told me to get in the car and drive it and I could drive!.. the point is I’d like to help but I can’t. I’m an idiot. I don’t have the vocabulary. Harry thinks this over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then we’ll just have to figure one out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT LOCAL TRACK, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Cole in the car, crew members nearby. Harry leans in the window. His manner is confidential.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - when you go to the doctor and tell him you have a headache what’s he liable to say?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (puzzled) I don’t know. I guess it depends on the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (impatiently) I don’t care who he is, he’s gonna ask ‘where does it hurt?’ And you’re probably gonna go, ‘it ™ hurts all over,’ and he’s gonna go, ‘does it hurt over your right eye?’ and you’re gonna go, ‘yeah, it hurts over my right eye’ and -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (embarrassed and annoyed) - all right, Harry I get it! you’re the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRACK
dialogues.text: Cole speeds down a straightaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY’S VOICE (on the radio) Well? How’s she feel?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I don’t know...like she’s looking around. HARRY’S VOICE - lookin’ around where?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing toward camera the car indeed is wandering a little from side to side. 59 60 61

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sort of like she’s huntin’ for somethin’. COLE’S VOICE (on radio) = yeah, huntin’. Harry smiles. He turns to the mechanic who holds a huge print out check list.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - castors gotta be laid back - The mechanic checks it off.

dialogues.speaker: COLE INTO TURN
dialogues.text: the car nearly sideways, and out of control.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Whoa!..her ass is all over the place - she’s, she’s bending in the middle - HARRY’S VOICE - loose -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Big time loose - But clearly Cole enjoys this more.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You like loose better.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, how do you know? HARRY’S VOICE - you like to be fast and on the edge of outta control, that’s loose -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - but not big time loose -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (to mechanic) - spring and shocks are soft -

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF CAR
dialogues.text: racing toward camera not wavering - on a plumbline.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY V.0.
dialogues.text: - she huntin’?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Hell no. She’s right on it. She‘s trackin’.

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE TURN 67
dialogues.text: still pretty hairy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Pushy or loose?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (pleased) ~ loose - HARRY’S VOICE But not big time loose.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Ten four. He whips into another turn in a perfect groove. He zooms across the stripe. Harry is tickled.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE CAR HARRY AND COLE
dialogues.text: walk side by side on the track. Cole sips a gatorade. Harry’s coon dog meanwhile has leapt out of the crew van caught up to the two of them. It tries to get Harry to pl Harry finds a pebble and heaves it. The dog goes tearing off.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - see before you come here you was runnin’ road courses where there’s this gentlemen’s agreement nobody gets too close to each other, cos when open wheel tires so much as touch, shit you go straight up in the air and fly to New York. That kind of racin’s between the driver and the road - in stock cars it’s between the drivers - (he has to heave the rock for the dog again) In other words contact with other drivers beats the car up enough. You don’t want to punish her yourself. This time Cole throws the rock for the coon dog. He final seems relaxed.  Nov 20.1989. 31.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Now Cole, there’s something else - tires is what wins a race. Cole regards Harry suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - if we can’t figure a way to run so you don’t melt the damn tires, we can’t finish a race.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: So what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Run fifty laps any way you like then - fifty laps like I want you to - give me an honest run. If you do I’m gonna beat you.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Don’t change me. HARRY . Think your driving can’t improve?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I didn’t say that. Look I’11 take your word for what a car can do but I don’t want to take anybody's word for what I can do because nobody knows. Nobody knows, godammit!..that’s what racing’s for, to find that out, all right, all right, godammit Harry, I’11 try it! He turns abruptly and heads back to the car. Harry watche him a moment, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRACK, (DAY)
dialogues.text: The car zooms across the stripe as a timer hits the stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIRES
dialogues.text: blistered and smoking are pulled off by crew members wear heavy gloves. One of the tires rolls over a lucite clipboard. The lucite sizzles and melts.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: All right this time you’re gonna come down on the throttle easy, you‘re gonna drag up easy, and you’re gonna settle in the brakes, and - and -  Nov 20 1989. 32. Cole is nodding like a browbeaten kid. Meanwhile crew members have finally replaced the tires and the car hits road.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (as it takes off) ~ I don’t want the ass hangin’ out from that car!

dialogues.speaker: EXT CHARLOTTE CHEVROLET, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Harry’s van pulls into the service area. He says somethin to Junior. In a moment Daland comes hurrying out.

dialogues.speaker: A TIRE
dialogues.text: rells to Daland. It is blistered and shredded. HARRY’S VOICE - his way ~ my way.. Another tire rolls to Daland. It is worn but in remarkabl shape by contrast. Tim looks down at the dramatic difference. Harry into SHOT. He holds a stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I was 6 seconds faster..buy me some lunch at that highway joint, Tim. INT. HARRY’S VAN HARRY AND DALAND (MOVING) 71 Daland glances at the rear of the van. Cole and Harry’: c dog are completely crapped out in the back seats.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: = you ran, you showed him the watch and he just went right to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yawned and went to sleep, yessir.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: He wadn’t suprised?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Didn’t appear to be.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: He didn’t get mad your way was faster?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nossir. Wasn‘’t even curious.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Well, Harry, what in the world makes that damn Yankee tick? have you any idea? Harry glances into the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tim, I want you to turn around and look to your right. Somewhat surprised, Daland does. Harry’s coon dog has his head out the right rear window, eyes closed, flews flappi nose in the air and twitching with all the wonderful smel at seventy miles an hour.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Now look to your left. Daland does.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: has his head hanging out the left rear window, eyes close hair flying, nose in the air and blissful in the headlong rush of wind. Daland looks to Harry. Harry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Talent ain’t real complicated.

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRACK, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Dr. Jerry Punch stands quietly on the deserted front stre of Pocono, addressing camera:

dialogues.speaker: PUNCH
dialogues.text: - you might think I’m on the landing strip of a major metropolitan airport, but what you’re looking at is the longest straightaway in NASCAR history, three thousand seven hundred and forty feet, where drivers exceed speeds of 180 miles an hour here at Pocono International Speedway, a unique two and a half mile tri-oval (diagram superimposed on screen) many drivers consider one of the very toughest -

dialogues.speaker: DALE EARNHARDT
dialogues.text: (insert) Turn one and the tunnel turn is where I’ve had my two worst accidents in my career - A fiery crash into boilerplate fencing.  Nov 20 1989. . 34.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY BURNS
dialogues.text: (insert) - broke collar bones and bruised my heart and everything else, it’s been a rough race track for me - Another car and another fiery crash.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION SET IN CITY CHEVROLET SEMI 73
dialogues.text: is carrying the coverage above. Cole, dressed in his raci suit, passes it. Harry, Daland and other crew surround th race car in pit lane below. No one is talking much.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We're trying to figure out what to do. :

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: - (exasperated) - Rowdy took the pole in 59:70, we run 62:10. We’re two seconds off the pace! we’re looking for some speed outta this thing - He points contemptuously at the car, glaring at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (his fear coming through) - we're in trouble.. Cole pops the top on his Pepsi, sips at the froth.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - car’s perfect, Harry. He gives Harry an appreciative pat on the back, starts of and stops abruptly:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - geez I’m hungry. Think I got time for a hot dog? Everyone is too astonished to respond. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: (a crew member) I’1l get you one, Cole.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Thanks. And Buck, just mustard, okay? get ’em to hold the onions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. 35. FULL ‘SHOT RACE - TRACK 74 Jarrett and Parsons keep up their running commentary whic intermittent and V.0. :

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT
dialogues.text: ~ we're just underway here at the AC Spark Plug 500 - into turn one again it is Rowdy Burns in the. Waddell Chilton/Exxon Chevrolet lumina - Jarrett names the 1st 10 cars. Cole is net one of them. Parsons speaks of turn one as one of the most terrifying corners in racing. Speeding at 180 miles an hour the cars four and five abreast have to enter the turn single file see this as Parsons tells us about it - there is room for car at a time around the turn. Cole is the thirty-third c through the turn and can be seen subsequently on the straightaway passing other cars. He moves up rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: in the pits and on the radio:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Watch the damn tires. We got a whole race to run, you know.

dialogues.speaker: WITH COLE
dialogues.text: He ducks into turn two barely getting in front of the fou car he passes. As he does his left tire hits the grass an the car swerves kicking up dirt. Jarrett lets us know tha this is not unusual in turn two, drivers have to put thei left tire on the grass to get through it, it is so narrow treacherous. As Cole exits Parsons points out that the ca have to hit this narrow ten foot patch or they’re liable hit the wall.

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD TURN THREE
dialogues.text: Cole glimpsed moving out and around two more cars. Superimpose: Turn 3 banking: 6 degrees radius: 800 feet. NED JARRETT V.O. - the third turn is critical in that if you don’t get off it good you aren’t going down to the front straightaway very fast which is where you take the checkered flag - Ned and Benny agree that if you’ve got the lead on this t near the end of a race you’re gonna have to be beaten in straightaways - you can’t pass on the turns without endin in the wall or on the infield.  Nov 20 1989. 36.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: roaring along smocthly in a pack of cars only inches from each other.

dialogues.speaker: SPOTTER
dialogues.text: (on radio) ~ crash in turn one! crash in turn one! it’s gonna be comin’ up in the bottom of the track Cole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Cole rips into a thick cloud of smoke and sparks and cars twisting in front of his face. He jerks the whee to the right, avoids the fiery pile-up - slides perilousl close to the boilerplate wall through the turn.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (on radio) - nice driving, good job - But a loose wheel on fire has rolled from the infield gra back onto the track - just where Cole comes off the turn. The flames fan his fender. HARRY’S VOICE - you okay? you okay?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - just dodged another bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three cars are out. Paramedics have rushed in. Jarrett an Parsons remind us of the track’s dangers. Jerry Punch on road has a quick word with one of the drivers - hard luck Aldo Benedetti, the gifted engineer who’s built his own c which is now in shards around hin.

dialogues.speaker: THE YELLOW FLAG IS FLYING
dialogues.text: Rowdy Burns swings onto pit road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY’S VOICE - leader has just taken the flag!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (into radio) Can I stay out? HARRY’S VOICE ~- better play monkey-see- monkey do.  Nov 20 1989. . 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole comes flying into pit road. The over-the-wall-gang leap into action. It’s a classic pit stop - ballsy ballet a controlled frenzy of flying bodies, gas hoses, jackhamm and tires ~ the car hits the road in less than 13 seconds The time runs superimposed on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Go! go! go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole pulls back onto the track still under yellow. Jarret comments on the remarkable pit stop of Trickle’s City Chevrolet crew under Harry Hogge - it’s allowed the young rookie to get back on the track in under 13 seconds and p up several more positions on the field.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREEN FLAG
dialogues.text: at the stripe and cars roar across. Jarrett lets us know that Cole Trickle is now 15th having moved up twenty positions from 36th after ninety-six laps, nearly the half-way mark of the race. ~

dialogues.speaker: BENNY PARSONS V.O.
dialogues.text: ~ the rookie seems to be running a lot smoother today, Ned - NED JARRETT V.O. yes indeed, although he didn’t qualify that good at the moment Cole Trickle appears to have one of the strongest cars on the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: HARRY’S VOICE 61:12, leader is 61:32, keep it consistent. THROUGH BINOCULARS - DALAND’S TRUCK 87 Daland watches from the top of the truck. He sees Cole pi up another spot. Listens on his own phones: HARRY‘’S VOICE 60:70, the leader’s 61:10, you’re picking up over half a second a lap now, back off or you’re gonna burn up the damn tires, take it easy -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. 38. COLE’S VOICE - I am taking it easy -

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT
dialogues.text: - moving into the number five spot behind Harry Gant is Cole Trickle in the 46 car -

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STRAIGHTAWAY
dialogues.text: Cole passes Gant and Waltrip. He’s now in third position. HARRY ’S VOICE 61:10 - leader’s 61:40 Harry and the crew can’t believe it - NED JARRETT’S VOICE - and there goes Cole Trickle around Earnhardt - Cole ducks in front of Mr. Goodwrench just before the tur barely making it. He’s now in second position.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY BURNS . -" INT. ROWDY 89
dialogues.text: spots green and yellow in his mirror. He smiles. Cole mov to pass him on the outside. Rowdy cuts him off. Cole appears to have the quicker car. He nudges Rowdy. Rowdy can’t believe it. He’s shocked at the bump.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: breaks out of Rowdy’s draft and moves to the outside. Nos to nose, they roar into the deadly first turn. NED JARRETT V.0O. - somebody’s going to have to give way here -

dialogues.text: Rowdy returns the bump - sends Cole skittering to the wal

dialogues.speaker: BENNY PARSONS
dialogues.text: - oh dear - The car is sideways. It scrapes the wall.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PIT HARRY
dialogues.text: is screaming inte the phones to back off. He can‘t be hea over the roar.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: comes through the turn right on Rowdy’s ass. Rowdy is surprised - and indignant when Cole nudges him again. He momentarily looks back at Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989, 39. WADDELL’S VOICE Rowdy there’s a bunny rabbit on the track! - TRACK o4 Rowdy looks - sure enough there’s a rabbit paralyzed with terror on the straightaway dead ahead. Rowdy moves to the right. Cole dives to the inside, both men barely missing the rabbit - but now Cole has position on the inside goin through the turn. He holds it. Burns tries to stay with him but can’t. His car goes sideways and he nearly loses his rear end - when they come out of the turn: BENNY PARSON’S VOICE - now there’s a good example of what you were talking about Ned, you just can’t pass on the outside in turn three, the track is too flat, the tires won't stick - not even if you’re Rowdy Burns.

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT
dialogues.text: - we have a new leader here at the AC Spark Plug 500 after 176 laps, Cole Trickle - if he can hold on for 24 more laps, he just could win his first Winston Cup race, how about that? Harry and the pit crew are going nuts. - PITS 95 DALAND - DALAND‘S TRUCK 96 climbs down from the truck and rushes to the pits.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE TRACK
dialogues.text: Rowdy has inched up alongside Cole. He bumps him. NED JARRETT V.O. - well there they go tradin’ paint again, Benny Parsons ~

dialogues.speaker: BENNY PARSONS
dialogues.text: - it’s door handle to door handle all right, but as we’ve pointed out Ned this is not a real forgivin’ race track - I don’t see how much longer they can keep this up without getting into trouble - WITH HARRY - PITts 98 He sees the two cars glued together like Siamese twins go into turn three - he’s ready to jump out of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (into radio) . All right, godammit that’s enough! Either pass him and stay ahead or give to him - you can’t play: with Rowdy like this - he’s gonna give you a reali ass ripping - Harry watches as the two cars zoom past. COLE’S VOICE - relax Harry, Rowdy’s not gonna last three more laps -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars approach turn one. The track narrows to one groove. Rowdy and Cole race to it - Cole gets there first but Rowdy’s gone too far, he can’t duck in. He goes high, spins and smacks the wall. Cole comes smoothly out of the turn. COLE’S VOICE - oops - one lap - He plumblines down the straightaway as the caution flag c out. NED JARRETT V.O. - the caution’s out with just under five laps to go, Cole Trickle maintains the lead, and Benny Parsons I believe he’s gonna win this race - HARRY’S VOICE . - pit road’s open, come on in and. get some tires -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole zooms into the pits. Other cars follow. The over-the wall-gang come up, jack up the car - and the lug nuts stick. Then the air gun jams - and Cole is hoisted up in the air screaming. The pit crew scrambles around for another air gun. In the other pits the drivers complete their stops and race back onto the track. Cole’s crew finally gets the tires changed. He charges ba onto the track. He finds himself behind Earnhardt and Waltrip. NED JARRETT’S VOICE - well that’s a shame. What do you think the problem was Benny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. 41. BENNY PARSON’S VOICE . Well it appears the lug nuts stuck - but when you come this far, you hate to have it cost you the race - particularly after you run as good as Trickle has - Harry is trying to reach Cole. - PITS 101

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Cole, Cole can you hear me? can you hear me? say something. COLE’S VOICE - motherfucking-son-of-a-bitch-

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Now Cole -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I come into the pits in first place, I’m so far ahead huntin’ dogs couldn’t find me and I come out third with two laps to go.

dialogues.speaker: TIM DALAND WITH HARRY
dialogues.text: listens and looks positively stricken

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Now you ain’t beat. Not yet. COLE’S VOICE Well I’d like to know what the hell I can do about it. Daland wants to know too.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well first of all you don’t want to get excited, Cole. You’re in third place. That’s a pretty respectable position - (Cole starts swearing again} - okay what you do is this. When they shut off over there for turn three, you just keep your foot on the gas and drive right by ’em - uhh - on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: WITH COLE
dialogues.text: still under the caution behind the pace car. He’s shocked

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Hell, I’m not that stupid.

dialogues.speaker: WITH HARRY
dialogues.text: Harry looks up 42.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You’1l be stupid if you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Harry - you told me I couldn’t pass on turn three.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (calmly) Well I’m telling you different now. That car will take it on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: {apoplectic) You‘’re gonna get him killed! - the pace car’s bar lights are blinking.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: {trying for calm) Now Cole, the pace car’s about xveady to duck on off, we don’t have a whole lot of time to talk about this -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Well tell me how -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - well it’s cos we got a real good set of matched tires on her -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (firmly) - that’s why I wanted you to pit in the first place, we been savin’ ‘em for just such an occasion, those tires are matched perfect and staggered special, your pit crew’s not dead in here, we’re thinking of you. Daland looks at Harry interested himself.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - all right Harry when it comes to the car, I’1l take your word -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - pace car’s off the track, if you go to the outside you can hold it -

dialogues.speaker: THE GREEN FLAG AND THE WHITE FLAG
dialogues.text: are waved simultaneously - Earnhardt, Waltrip and Cole cr the stripe and roar to full speed.

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT
dialogues.text: - here we are under green in the final lap of the AC Spark Plug 500 and going into the first turn it’s Earnhardt, Waltrip and Trickle - The cars go through the narrow turn nose to tail.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY PARSONS
dialogues.text: - it pretty much looks like that’s the order of finish here Ned with one lap to go - The cars head toward the tunnel turn nose-to-tail and mov down the straightaway going inte turn three with Earnhard leading, Waltrip trying to break the draft and move outsi with Cole just behind Waltrip. They hit turn three. Waltr is slightly outside Earnhardt and Cole is outside Waltrip

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR EARNHARDT
dialogues.text: steps on the clutch and gears down.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR WALTRIP 108
dialogues.text: steps on the clutch and gears down.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE 109
dialogues.text: steps on the gas and prays.

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE CARS
dialogues.text: tear into the turn. Cole on the outside has all four tire smoking as he lays rubber and fishtails wildly into the l stuff. His car goes completely sideways. Through the roar of the crowd Jarrett’s incredulous reaction to Cole’s mov can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE 111
dialogues.text: continues to slide and fishtail toward the wall. He keeps his foot on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: turns away.

dialogues.speaker: OFF THE TURN
dialogues.text: Earnhardt and Waltrip break into frame on the bottom of t track - but in FG a green and yellow blur fills the frame obliterating everything else.

dialogues.speaker: THE STRIPE
dialogues.text: The three cars streak toward it - with the green nose of Cole’s car just inches ahead of the other two. Cole takes the checkered flag.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY PARSONS
dialogues.text: (flabbergasted) - Ned I should know better. Just when I say somethin’ can’t be done on a race track some rookie’s gonna come along and make a liar outta me - he come off that last corner like he was tied to a string, didn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: COLE AT VICTORY LANE 114
dialogues.text: is hauled out of the car by his riotous crew. Photographe and Dr. Jerry Punch (with ESPN mike) surround him. Cole grabs Harry, hugging him.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (affectionately) - I owe it all to you, you son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - oh hell -

dialogues.speaker: PUNCH
dialogues.text: Cole Trickle, did you have any idea you could go wide open on that last turn and make the car stick like that? Cole is all smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Knew it all along.

dialogues.speaker: PUNCH
dialogues.text: - how’s that?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Special tires. He points to the tires. Punch looks down at them, puzzled

dialogues.speaker: PUNCH
dialogues.text: What’s special about ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) - nothin’ particular..

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (pulling Harry aside) - but you told me -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - well I lied, I had to tell you somethin’ to calm you down, you was acting like such a candy~ass after the air gun stuck, figured you’d never get back on a race track -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~ you son of a bitch! He goes after Harry, but Daland and the crew hit the woul warriors with champagne spray and their hostility -is dro in bubbly. Both men laugh. Photographs are taken - a rapid series of freeze frames a Cole goes through the victory ritual of doffing dozens of race sponsor hats. Daland interrupts the freeze frame flo

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Try this on for size. Cole and Harry look at the hat. It says Superflo. Daland puts it on Cole’s head, another on Harry’s head, one more his own. :

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: We got us a sponsor! More champagne over the three of them. Through the shower

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - promise me somethin’, boys. Whatever else we do from here - we win Daytona - Before Cole can answer he is grabbed by the honey haired Winston and surrounded by other beauty queens to have his picture taken. They hang all over hin.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (to Harry) Look at that. He’s actually shy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, he’ll get over it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY, (DAY)
dialogues.text: The City Chevrolet semi hums along the turnpike, with Har Hoogerhyde the gigantic gas-man on the pit crew manning t wheel. He’s singing along with a raucous duet that comes from a speaker in his cab.

dialogues.speaker: DUET
dialogues.text: - I’m puttin’ you in my rear view It sure has been a lot of fun, but now I’m comin’ thru -

dialogues.speaker: INT SEMI, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Y Harry with other crew members and a gorgeous pit lizard : sprawled in the sitting room behind the cab, plucking l on a banjo, drinking beer, whiskey and a little moonshine holding forth:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ~ there was this coal mine I a believed was gonna make me rich, . it was sold to me so good all I > could see was an assfull of money, toe racing, charity, hell I proceeded I, : to go up in the mountains and get : : in on this coal mine. So I'm . sitting there waitin’ on this guy, |. here comes these trucks with big : loads of coal going up the mountain, up that road. Dozens of ‘em. It shoulda dawned on me I guess, but it didn’t. Now what the hell are they doing hauling coal up the mountain - the coal is supposed to come down the . mountain, don’t you see? crystal ° ) clear, can’t miss it, but I did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: } Cole who is lying in a corner only half-listening has g increasingly attentive. He chuckles. As Harry keeps I talking, Cole laughs harder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (going on) ~ these mountains had been worked out for fifty years but they’d . show guys like me truckloads of \ : coal they’d supposedly loaded that @ay, sell ‘em thousands of dollars worth of useless mining stock, 1 move off and they’re never heard be from again. They call that a dog and pony show, I had to learn that ' the hard way - ' . Cole is laughing even harder. ! ' Harry breaks off. As far as he’s concerned Cole has b an overappreciative audience. Harry goes over to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: : ~ well it may be funny but it’s | not that funny when it happens to you - Cole continues laughing.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: , - it happened to me... Harry’s dumbfounded. He sits.

dialogues.speaker: . HARRY
dialogues.text: ~- what happened to you? You ‘ we : bought worthless mining stock?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (drinking a beer) ~ I told you I lost my ride? That’s how I lost it. The team owner was a con man..junk bonds, worthless companies, but mainly he sold stolen yachts. When I'd won enough races he even used my name to promote his sales. One day it caught up with him, he went to jail and I lost my ride - it was pretty humiliating actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry’s affected by the story. He puts a hand on Cole’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hell, Cole there’s no need to be embarrassed by some low life piece of trash who'd put you in that LN kind of position. wy

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I Well Harry, that depends. Is HARRY On what?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: On whether or not you're related to that low life piece of trash - it was my father. Cole laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five, six years ago.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: " ~ you lost your ride five or six years ago?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: } - yeah. Haven’t really been able ] to stick with anything since, Harry they don’t trust me, I don’t trust them, you know how it goes ~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dec 19 1989 47. Harry nods, full of feeling. Cole can see Harry wants to something comforting.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: For instance you lied to me today. It was dumb luck I didn’t end up crashed or dead. I oughta “punch you out.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ~ give it a try.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No ~ I don’t want to get the shit kicked out of me by a sixty year old man - That does it. Harry goes for Cole. ‘lhe two begin tusslin Buck, a crew member, meanwhile is arm wrestling with a gorgeous pit lizard, DARLENE, six feet, formed with great tits, great ass'and anabolic steroids and getting the bet of Buck. Cole and Harry knock themselves to the floor - they're like a pair of cubs, playing rough and where the playing is going to end and the rough takes over neither knows. “

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Cole, we was settin’ in the money spot, I wouldn't a wrecked you for nothin’ in the world...

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: He wouldn’t a wrecked that car for nothin’ in the world -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (pinning Cole) It’s a never never land out there, don’t get me wrong and drivers just don’t go to the outside like that - but I knew you could do it. I believed it in my heart. {holding an empty mason jar) ~ peach or cherry - ee

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - cherry. ‘ Cole flops back, through half-closed eyes sees the girl, Darlene, watching him while Buck talks.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: (quietly) - there’s calculatin’ drivers and kamikaze drivers. Cole there’s a kamikaze like my pappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole smiles a little.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: . BUCK
dialogues.text: “opt . Buddy Bretherton. COLE ‘ Buddy Bretherton was your Dad? He drove for Harry.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: - 17 years.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~- died at Daytona didn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: - just last year, “Cole sits up. Harry’s come back with the moonshine but w in the doorway. Cole doesn’t see him.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: How'd it happen? mind my asking? . moo BUCK ' (reluctantly) - hit the wall...

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~ which turn?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (anxious to end the conversation) ~- he was probably dead before he hit it. Coroner’s report showed ! massive heart attack - probably o why he hit it in the first place -  Nov 20 1989. 49. Harry comes back in.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Buck says we were alike -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: {remembering fondly despite himself) - yeah, he’d push a car to the edge knowing it could break loose any minute and go ass over bandbox and then he’d take it just a little bit more - He hands Cole the cherry moonshine.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: - You ever think about crashin’, Cole? Harry watches Cole for his answer. Cole laughs.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - no. % {the truth of this hits him) - no, I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Well I do.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: (surprised) When do you think about it?

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Right now, Buck. She’s got very little on an amazing bottom and the scante teshirt on top.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: I’m bored - (looking at Cole) - anybody wants to come and get wrecked, I’1l be just around the corner —- She walks down the steps into the other room. Buck looks Cole.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: She can suck start a Harley at 30 below zero.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Buck. JI been enough of a kamikaze for one day.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY, (DAY)
dialogues.text: The sirens of two Highway Patrol cars are screaming as th pull up alongside the semi, signalling Harlan to pull ove

dialogues.speaker: INT SEMI 118
dialogues.text: as the door rudely opens and Darlene and Buck, hopelessly entwined nearly fall into the road. They try to scramble some kind of cover.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY PATROL OFFICER
dialogues.text: All right, everybody freeze. You’re under arrest. Harry with Cole staggers into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What the hell for?

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY PATROL OFFICER
dialogues.text: It’s right there in your hand. Transportation of illegal alcohol across state lines for the purpose of distribution -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know what this looks like to you officer, but this is not distribution, this - (displaying the empty Mason jar) ~- is consumption... He staggers.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY PATROL OFFICER
dialogues.text: That don’t exactly make it legal. Up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY PATROL OFFICER
dialogues.text: Up_ against the wall. Officers - Other uniformed HP officers, two men and one woman move briskly through the truck and begin te pat down Harry, Co and the others.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: {patting down Cole) - well, looks like we’ve found something -

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY PATROL OFFICER
dialogues.text: What’s that?  ere See ee

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: - concealed weapon -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (turning around, indignant) - what! The female officer promptly turns Cole back to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Where? just show me where.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Right here - With that she unzips Cole’s fly and uses what she finds a handle to turn him around.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (facing a shocked Cole) - now the only question is, will he actually use it? She tosses off her hat. Long blonde hair tumbles out. She plants a big kiss on Cole, and everyone’s laughing. They’ all in on the joke.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: - please don’t be mad, Harry and the boys thought you might like me..

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - Well, miss, as you know they’re all a bunch of dumb, crude, drunken louts, especially Harry - but - they could be right - And with that he kisses her back, to applause and relief.

dialogues.speaker: INT DALAND BEDROOM, (NIGHT)
dialogues.text: Lauren sits up in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Tim? Tim honey - somebody’s messin’ around in the yard. Daland reaches under the bed for a shotgun and a flashlig and staggers to the window. He gives a little grunt of surprise and sets the shotgun against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: EXT DALAND HOUSE, (NIGHT)
dialogues.text: The floodlights go on revealing Cole, dead drunk. His Winston Cup trophy is precariously balanced on the edge o the water well into which he’s dropping the cherries, one one, the dregs from his otherwise empty Mason jar. He spo Tim in a bathrobe coming towards him.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: - got lost on the way home, did you?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - not really...thought I'd pay you a visit -

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (grabbing Cole before he falls) - well that’s real neighborly -

dialogues.speaker: INT LIVING ROOM DALAND 121
dialogues.text: sets up the sofa with sheets while Cole sways unsteadily, checking out some family photos on a piano, including som Tim at his dealership.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: --Tim did you always want to sell cars?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Hell, yes, doedn’t everybody? you’re all set... Cole staggers to the sofa, stares at his trophy on the co table. Daland touches the trophy.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Truth is what I really wanted was to be a race car driver.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (pleased to hear it) You drove?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Were you good?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Well what kept you from it?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: - guys like you. Some drivers, they’re happy just doin’ what they love, that kinda deal. I’m not that way. I gotta be the best - good night, buddy. Daland gives Cole a pat and heads out.  Nov 20 1989. 53.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You ever crash?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: - iddy bitty ones is all.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Then how do you really know you weren’t good enough?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (coming back, sitting on the coffee table) I guess I knew my limits without having to test ’em...can’t drive a race car as good as I’d like, but hells bells it’s a thrill to watch you drive, Cole. On top of that youre gonna make us all rich. COLE . - Harry told me I’d stick in the ° third turn cos I had special tires.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (amused) I heard him - only thing special out there today was you.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Is that right? So..whatta you think, Tim? Was I good or was I lucky?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: ~ when you’re real good you’re real lucky. He gets up again.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: How good and how lucky?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (stepping again) Well you just keep doin’ it and we’ll find out.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - for how long? how long before you find out if you’re really good or really lucky?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (exasperated, laughing) Cole that’s like my five year old when she asks, ‘Daddy how long before it’s morning?’

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What do you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Go to sleep!.. Daland walks out of the living room.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Hey Tim - Daland pokes his head back in the doorway, annoyed despit himself:

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: - what?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: How long before it’s morning? Cole chuckles wickedly and plunks his head down on the pillow. He’s asleep almost instantly. Daland remains in t doorway, still smiling held by the afterglow of Cole’s playfulness, amused but bemused as well by the troubling questions.

dialogues.speaker: ALDO BENEDETTI EXT. TRACK B 122
dialogues.text: Goody’s Headache Powder’s hard luck hard charger, stands his race car. His expression is grave. He addresses camer

dialogues.speaker: ALDO
dialogues.text: I keep hoping for a race that doesn’t give me a headache, but as leng as these guys are runnin’ = First Rowdy in his racing suit walks by:

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: ~ good luck today, Aldo -

dialogues.speaker: ALDO
dialogues.text: Thanks Rowdy - Cole Trickle in his racing togs saunters by:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - good luck out there, Aldo -  Nov 20 1989. 55.

dialogues.speaker: ALDO
dialogues.text: Thanks Cole - (to camera) ~ - the headaches keep comin’. INT ALDO’S RACE CAR 123 Aldo screeches into a pit stop. The Gatorade cup flies in Aldo desperately tears open a couple of Goody’s Headache packages off his dashboard - where dozens more are taped. downs the Goody’s and zooms out of the pit.

dialogues.speaker: IMPISH VOICE OVER
dialogues.text: “Goody’s" for those headaches that just won’t quit - This last over two quick cuts - one of Rowdy, the other o Cole tearing down the track and passing Aldo whose car is stopped once again - as he’s getting a traffic ticket.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: EXT RACE TRACK (DAYTONA) DAY i: 124 BOB JENKINS V.O. - you’re looking at the number 46 car of Cole Trickle who’s leading here at the Firecracker 400 in Daytona, Florida - that Superflo Chevy Lumina running out front is an increasingly familiar sight, isn't it Ned Jarrett? NED JARRETT V.O. - yes indeed, Bob Jenkins, since his Pocono victory, Trickle has gone on to win at Michigan, at Watkins Glen, and how he’s one car away from lapping the entire field 146 laps into the race - BENNY PARSONS V.O. Lately he’s been a headache for Aldo Benedetti and about 39 other drivers - During Jarrett’s V.0. coverage include insert ESPN bites all four corners of the screen - Cole winning Pocono, Col winning Michigan, Cole winning Watkins Glen and in the fo corner Cole in victory lane being interviewed, radiating confidence and poise ~ "our Superflo/Chevy Lumina did everything we asked out there" - since the night on Dalan sofa Cole has become a risen star, on the way to being la than life.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY PARSONS V.O.
dialogues.text: - right now he’s giving Rowdy Burns more than a headache -

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT V.O.
dialogues.text: He‘s liable to get more than a headache from Rowdy if they keep this up - This exchange because Cole has come up behind Burns who g high and low to keep Cole from passing. Cole’s response i nudge on Rowdy’s bumper. As they slam and bam back and fo and bother the cars around them: NED JARRETT V.O. - these sorts of rivalries, while they may be fun for the fans, are always dangerous - not only to themselves but to the other drivers - Inserts of Cole and Rowdy in the corner of the screen - R responding to Nascar warnings that he and Cole have cause other drivers to crash and Cole denying that he’s racing anyone in particular - ‘you worry about one guy, you turn your back on the rest of ‘em, and you can’t afford to do that -’. BENNY PARSONS V.O. Well he says it but does he mean it?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRACK COLE
dialogues.text: nudges Rowdy’s bumper again, and loosens it. INT ROWDY’S CAR 127 At 170 miles an hour he can hear the bumper rattling. He swears. INT COLE’S CAR 128 HARRY’S VOICE (on radio} - stop messin’ with him, he’s not gonna give to you -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - c’mon, just one more tap - And he does it. Rowdy’s bumper really rattles.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: is practically foaming with fury.  Nov 20 1989. S7.

dialogues.speaker: WADDELL
dialogues.text: (on radio) - that bumper gets any looser, Rowdy and they’re gonna black flag you - let him go by -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rowdy signals to Cole to let him pass. Cole moves to the outside on the turn and Rowdy really slams him. Cole lose his rear end. Cole spins, smoking, and looks like he’s going right into wall - but does a perfect 360 and barely scrapes it - he keeps on going and passes Rowdy. The crowd goes wild. Rowdy is furious.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you were so worried about, Harry -

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PIT HARRY . 132
dialogues.text: with Daland looks like he’s nearly had a coronary. But bo men look up to see Cole pass by and wave, obviously in complete control. They look at one another and shake thei heads. BENNY PARSONS V.0. - well Ned Jarrett, that boy knows something about race cars I sure don’t -

dialogues.speaker: A FAN
dialogues.text: twists the cap off a beer bottle and tosses it. It rolls through the fencing and onto the track at turn four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole’s car comes into the turn at over 180 miles an hour hits the bottle cap. His right front tire is punctured. In a flash Cole caroms off one car, gets sideways, and th backwards which sends him airborne at least fifteen to tw feet over the track. He comes crashing down into and alon the wall end over end at first and then endless barrel rolling, a whirling dervish of smoke and flames with exploding pieces of machinery spewing out. It looks as if nothing will be left of the car when the smoke clears. An when it does, it reaveals little more than the roll cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stirs, swears and starts to answer Harry’s frantic rad call. Then he looks up. .

dialogues.speaker: TRACK 136
dialogues.text: Coming down the track toward him at 180 miles an hour, th cars are three a breast. There’s no way they can all avoi him.

dialogues.speaker: ONE CAR
dialogues.text: T-bones him brutally - sending him down the track, smokin and crumpled into the infield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other cars meanwhile have piled up and wrecked - Rowdy avoided Cole but hit the car Cole caromed off - lost his bumper, causing cars behind him to lose control, rear end him and send him into the wall where he now hangs upside down over a guard rail. His helmet is off his head and he badly bruised. WADDELL’S VOICE (on radio) - pit and get four tires! pit and get four tires! %

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: (into radio) Waddell, I’m hanging upside down and they’re gonna have to cut me out of this race car. Now what in the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Daland rush toward the infield where Cole’s car a smoking ruin.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (into radio as they’re going) Cole, can you hear me? do you copy? can you say something? COLE’S VOICE (on radio) - let me catch my breath, okay?..I feel like I’m in one piece, but I’m really not sure -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (stopping, with Daland) What do you mean you’re not sure?- COLE’S VOICE Well, I can’t see anything - (a funny laugh) - I’m blind...I feel okay, Harry but I’m blind - Harry and Daland take off on a dead run.  Jan 23 1990, " 59.

dialogues.speaker: IN ESPN TRUCK
dialogues.text: The camera crew is going crazy with their video banks, fr replay of the crash, to isolated shots of Rowdy’s crash, isolated shots of Cole’s crash, to crew reactions like Harry’s and Daland’s, to the inboard POV shot looking ove Cole’s shoulder as the car dips, hits another car, spins, gets airborne - and then on crashing into the wall, loses picture.

dialogues.speaker: INT EMERGENCY ROOM, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Cole, wheeled along in aa gurney, is swooped down on by nurses and doctors that make him seem like the object of feeding frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - could you wait, could you wait, could you tell me what’s going on, I can’t see - They’re using scissors to cut away his uniform working up from the ankles and the wrists, putting leads on his ches getting a cardiac monitor going, clamps on his finger for pulse oximeter, oxygen mask, etc. Cole starts to struggle against the attention he can’t see.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: a serious bruise on his forehead, is the object of simila attention. He watches himself being hooked up to monitori systems:

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: ~ I‘m not a car battery, I don’t need rechargin’ -

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
dialogues.text: - this is standard procedure -

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: - go fuck yourself - DR. CLAIRE LEWICKI, a young woman in surgical. greens, be over Rowdy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: - what was that, Mr. Burns? She checks out the bruise on his forehead. Rowdy checks h out. 140 142

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t tell you to do that, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: We‘ll see -

dialogues.speaker: WITH COLE
dialogues.text: thrasing around now, panicked. His legs are taped to the table, sandbags on either side of his head.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~ Ifm blind, godammit somebody’s gotta tell me what’s going on! He manages to tear himself half off the table. Dr. Lewick into SHOT. She puts her arm around his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, what’s your name? COLE ~‘ Cole Trickle..

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Cole, would you help us out and lie down please?

dialogues.speaker: INT CAT-SCAN COLE 143
dialogues.text: in lead-lined room, Dr. Lewicki speaking to him from the outside as he’s being readied for the MRI scan.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: You've had a concussion, your brain is bruised and like any bruise it’s going to swell. That swelling is almost certainly what’s affecting your vision.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You mean this’1ll go away?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI -
dialogues.text: - if that’s the problem, now we’re going to run some tests.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - what kind of tests?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: - I just need to confirm what’s going on, I never pass up the opportunity to see if a good looking man has a brain in his head - She continues preparatiens te run the MRI.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You’re a brain doctor?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: - yes -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: A good one?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: {she smiles) - so-so. Cole is obviously frightened.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Look, when I’m driving I got a guy who talks to me on the radio - I can’t see him but he talks to me - Cole has made a dent in her professional demeanor and Cla is touched.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: T/ll talk to you - The machine whirrs and a section of Cole’s brain is proje on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grainy movement of gray and blacks, like a negative being formed. He can see shapes in the room. Then the color bleeds in.

dialogues.speaker: INT NEURO INTENSIVE CARE, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Cole is looking at Harry, who is crumpled up in a chair, dozing, his spit cup in hand.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Harry you okay?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (with a start) Yeah, why? Now his eyes open. He watches Cole hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You look all bent outta shape. Oh hell, it’s probably my eyes -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - no, it’s me. I been here all night - I’1l get the doctor. He scurries out.

dialogues.speaker: INT WAITING ROOM 145
dialogues.text: Haggard crew members watch a rerun of Cole’s crash. Harry inte SHOT background coming to a halt by the main desk ac the hall.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where’s Dr. Lewicki? We can cverhear the nurse saying that Dr. Lewicki’s getti ready to go off duty.

dialogues.speaker: INT NEURO INTENSIVE CARE COLE 146
dialogues.text: smiles when he sees the crew coming in.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Damn nice to see you, Cole -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Damn nice to see you, Buck - A moment later Harry enters with Dr. Lewicki. She’s out o surgical greens and in a white smock over street clothes. Her appearance is dramatic. She’s young, she’s tall, and she’s striking.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - you've met Dr. Lewicki, Cole - Cole stares back without saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - your doctor, Dr. Lewicki -

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: (to Harry, pleasantly) - I don’t think he’s actually seen me -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (to Harry) Oh, sure, Harry, Dr. Lewicki - hi, doctor, how are you? Claire Lewicki smiles - walks across the room to greet Co

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (suddenly) - no Cole, this really is Dr. Lewicki -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - absolutely ~

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: - I was just about to go off duty -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - and you want to look me over before you go -

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Well that’s not a bad idea. You feel your vision’s restored?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (vainly) - Cole -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - Oh I think so - DR. LEWICKI “ - nothing’s blurred, you’re not seeing double? no halos around objects? no flashing lights? She pulls out an opthalmoscope.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What’re you going to do with that?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: ~ look into your eyes -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Now doctor, isn’t this what you're really looking for? Cole takes Lewicki’s hand and puts it under the covers, r ever his crotch. Harry about faints. Lewicki’s spins stiffens slightly. She keeps her hand on Cole’s crotch, however. It’s almost as though she is listening to it wit stethoscope:

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Well it seems interesting enough Mr. Trickle, but it’s just not my specialty - She withdraws her hand and walks out of the room just as Daland enters. A moment of stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - she’s the real thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. : 64. HARRY . I wouldn’t play no joke on you in a situation like this - (Harry giggles) . sorry, Cole, I’m trying not to smile - :

dialogues.speaker: INT HOSPITAL CORRIDOR, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Rowdy Burns in civilian clothes and a wheelchair is pushe briskly along by a no-nonsense nurse, preferably with a v like Eugene Palette’s.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: (furiously) - I can walk, godammit!

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Not as long as you’re in this hospital you can’t - They’re nearly blindsided by Cole - also in civilian clot and also pissed about being in a wheelchair. His Latino orderly has nearly banged him into Rowdy. The two drivers glare at one another, then continue down the corridor wheelchair to wheelchair in an unintentional reprise of t car race.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (whispering to his orderly) - I don’t wanna be next to this clown, couid you pick up the pace a little?..

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: {in heavily accented Spanish) If you wan’ drugs you gotta see the nurse, buddy - Cole swears. He grabs onto the wheels and whips them forward. Rowdy takes only a moment to react. He too picks up the pace staying even with Cole. The orderly and the gravelly nurse hasten to stay up with the escalating pace The two nearly run into Dr. Lewicki. She’s waiting outsid main floor conference room with Harry nearby.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Good morning, gentlemen. Right this way -

dialogues.speaker: INT CONFERENCE ROOM 148
dialogues.text: Several Nascar officials listen intently. Dr. Lewicki is running tape of the computer generated CAT-scan. Like two recalcitrant children Cole and Rowdy sit in their wheelch watching, along with Harry, Daland and Waddell (Rowdy’s c chief).  Nov 20 1989. 65.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: - neither Mr. Burns nor in this case Mr. Trickle present any significant intracranial injury - LEN DORTORT, an imposing official:

dialogues.speaker: DORTORT
dialogues.text: Hold it, doc let’s have that one in English. Did they mess up their squash or not?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Their brains are intact, (a glance at Cole) as much as they were before the accident anyway.

dialogues.speaker: DORTORT
dialogues.text: You’re willing to give em clearance to get back on a race track.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: - well, I, that’s obviously a dangerous way to spend your time -

dialogues.speaker: DORTORT
dialogues.text: - that’s a philosophical objection, Doc. I’m lookin’ for a medical one. In you professional epinion is there any reason these two men should not be allowed to return to racing? Now Rowdy and Cole are hanging on Dr. Lewicki’s tiniest gesture and she sees it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) - all the follow up scans have been negative, but no one of course can give you guarantees -

dialogues.speaker: DORTORT
dialogues.text: - young lady, we know you’re an accomplished physician - did you happen to see these boys crash?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Ifve never seen a race. I am, however, familiar with car crashes.

dialogues.speaker: DORTORT
dialogues.text: At 180 miles an hour? We can show it to you. Banjo -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. 66. One of the NASCAR officials pulls out a tape of his own. starts to put it in the VCR:

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: - I ain’t lookin’ at that sumbitch.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: It isn’t necessary. I’m not inclined to give them clearance at this time. Both Rowdy and Cole start to protest.

dialogues.speaker: DORTORT
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, please - what would you suggest then?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: A re-evaluation in another week or two. Again they start to protest. ™

dialogues.speaker: DORTORT
dialogues.text: Thank you, doc - now we have a little something to say to the boys here. I don’t think you necessarily need to hear it ~- She leaves. Rowdy and Cole look hatefully at one another.

dialogues.speaker: DORTORT
dialogues.text: Okay, it’s Big John’s turn. BIG JOHN ENGLISH rises out of his chair and suddenly fill the room. It’s as though he sprouted out of the floor. He towers over the two drivers in their wheelchairs.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOHN
dialogues.text: - if you wanna turn yourselves into a greasy spot on a country road somewheres, go right ahead, I don’t give a shit and I don’t think anybody else does no matter what they say to your face - but you two monkeys are not gonna do it on my racetrack!.. Now y’all heard about Japanese inspection? Japanese inspection. Nobody here know about Japanese inspection? Well I’1l1 tell you about it. When the Japs get a load of lettuce they’re not so sure they want in the country, why they just let it set on the docks until they’re good and ready to look at it. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~ ————— Nov 20 1989. 67. BIG JOHN (cont’d) By that time it’s all gone rotten and there ain’t nothin’ left to inspect. In other words - lettuce is a perishable item, like you two monkeys. You trade paint one more time, you so much as touch, I’ll black flag the two of you and take apart your race cars for the next three hundred laps. Then, if you pass inspection and put your car back together, maybe I’11 let you finish the race - now to show us there’s no hard feelin’s, we’re all going out to dinner together -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I got other plans.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, so do I.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOHN
dialogues.text: You’1ll have to change em. Not only that, you two’ll drive to dinner together. He drops car keys on the table between them.

dialogues.speaker: INT HOSPITAL ROOM 149
dialogues.text: a large closet off the corridor - coffee bar, coke machin formica and cremora. Dr. Lewicki is having coffee and chatting with a good looking male colleague.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dr. Lewicki, I want to apologize for what happened with Cole when you come into the hospital room. Lewicki and the male doctor exchange glances. He discreet drifts on out.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKTI
dialogues.text: {graciously) Mr. Hogge, please, it’s nothing to worry about and in any case it was hardly your doing.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: {a cough) - that’s just it. I believe it was. Dr. Lewicki looks puzzled. Harry gets very red in the fac Then:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - not too long ago after he won Pecono we played a trick on Cole, dressed up a pretty girl ina highway patrol uniform...anyway we told her to get real ornery with him and - she did.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: By ornery you mean...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (deeply embarrassed) - real ornery.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Why would you want me to know about this?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t want you to hold a bad opinion of Cole..I believe it scares him - (a long pause) - you're his doctor. ‘ And Claire Lewicki sees Harry doesn’t want his race car driver scared.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HOSPITAL PARKING LOT, (DAY)
dialogues.text: with its Florida license plate surrounded by a BUDGET REN CAR frame. Cole into SHOT. He tries one of the car doors. It’s locked. He leans up against the car, waiting, eyes nearly closed. For the first time there’s a sense of exhaustion and aftershock from the crash. Some image nevertheless makes an impression. He takes off.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: is walking down a hospital ramp toward the parking lot, briefcase and car keys in hand. As she turns into the lot she sees Cole sprinting toward her. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Doctor!

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: - I heard you thought I was a highway patrol officer. It’s clearly a surprise to Cole that she knows about it. It’s mixed relief.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - I also wanted to thank you for taking care of me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) That’s my job.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well it’s my life. Cole looks like he’1l stand there all day. He either does want to move away from her or doesn’t know how to. Finall

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: (gently teasing) Well this time, let’s shake hands.. She extends hers. Cole nearly jumps.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: of course,

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Good luck, Cole. She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Dr. Lewicki! She turns back.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Could I see you?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: Oh you will, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No I mean would you have dinner with me? catch a movie or -

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: oh, that’s very sweet, really - but it’s not going to get you back on the track any faster.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No, it’s not that - She waves brightly, smiles crisply and turns away. Her ba is not to be argued with and Cole sees it. Then something else catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: is walking toward the green Chevrolet.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: now turns and walks toward the green Chevrolet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a little like a gunfighter’s shootout. Each step bri them closer to one another - until only the car’s roof separates them. Rowdy has reached the driver’s side, Cole the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Now here’s how I see this deal. You ain‘’t gonna want me to drive to dinner and I ain’t gonna want you to driver to dinner so there’s only one way to settle this.. He looks down at the car’s key chain and smiles again. He fingers the tag. It too says BUDGET RENT-A-CAR. Now Cole smiles. EXT BUDGET RENT-A-CAR OFFICE (DAY) idl The green Chevrolet is parked out front - next to an almo identical blue one. Cole and Rowdy exit the car office ea carrying a set of keys. A pleasant matronish woman follow

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Have a nice day, and ya’ll drive careful now, hear?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Oh yes mam. We sure will. Cole gets into the blue Chevrolet. Rowdy gets into the gr Chevrolet. Cole leans out the window.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Charthouse Restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: It’s called the Charthouse.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: That the finish?

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: First one to hit valet parking takes the checkered flag - how about the start? Cole looks down the road about a hundred and fifty yards.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: The stop sign.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: What else? Cole turns over his engine. Rowdy turns over his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jan 18 1990. . 72. as Cole and Rowdy walk in.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Too close to call?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~ yeah - aot omar omer tard Ink Jan 18 1990 . 71.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROAD, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: They travel side by side, scuffing their tires as though they’re on the track. The stop sign looms closer. They hi it and roar through the four way intersection - sendin * cross traffic skittering all over the road and into ditch The race is on.

dialogues.speaker: EXT COUNTRY ROAD AND CAUSEWAY, (NIGHT)
dialogues.text: a picturesque bridge crosses an expanse of peaceful moonl water. From out of the darkness comes the roar of two * engines. : * The stream of headlights on the bridge begins to break up horns honk, a fender crumples - the headlights on the bri are pointed in every direction, *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big John drums his fingers on the table and glares at a v uncomfortable Tim Daland. Big John checks his watch. *

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOHN
dialogues.text: Let me tell you somethin’, Tim. * If you can’t control your race * driver any bettern this, you might * consider stickin’ to something you * can control, like used cars in * downtown Charlotte. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two renta-cars have arrived. Battered and bleeding * hulks, spewing oil and water they are side by side in the valet-manned parking lot along with rows of shiny BMW’s, Mercedes, Porsches. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989, 73. She turns and spots Lewicki with the same good looking do she’d been with earlier.

dialogues.speaker: SECTY
dialogues.text: Dr. Lewicki would you please call this gentleman back before I run out of thumbtacks?

dialogues.speaker: GOOD LOOKING DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (eyeing messages) Same gentleman? Lewicki is politely dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEWICKI
dialogues.text: It’s a patient. The phone rings again. The secretary turns to answer it. WITH COLE AT HARRY’S - INT. HARRY’S GARAGE 160 He’s on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Tim, do you know anybody at Daytona Memorial? WITH TIM DALAND - INT. TIM’S OFFICE 161 in his office at City Chevrolet.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Chief of staff - why?

dialogues.speaker: COLE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: He a race fan?

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Is Florida in the South? WITH COLE - INT. HARRY’S GARAGE 162

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: {into SHOT) - Tim wants you to meet Russ Wheeler, he’s gonna be drivin’ for us till you get your medical clearance ~ Wheeler is a year or two younger than Cole, smooth, ingratiating - a Southern yuppie.

dialogues.speaker: RUSS
