dialogues.text: - real privilege to race your car, Mr. Trickle -  Nov 20 1989, 74. COLE’S VOICE - thanks for helping out - (into phone) - Tim, I need the home address of a doctor -

dialogues.speaker: RUSS
dialogues.text: ~ just sorry I won’t be able to drive it near as good as you - This last remark ruffles Cole’s concentration momentarily

dialogues.speaker: EXT MARINA, (EVENING)
dialogues.text: returning from work walks up the stairs to her apartment overlooking the bay. She opens the door and gapes. INT HARRY’S GARAGE 164 Harry and crew are working on the car, background, Cole i the phone, laughing: COLE ‘ - I was desperate to get your attention - INT LEWICKI’S APARTMENT 165 with Claire on the phone, in a room absolutely filled wit lush flowers and brightly colored balloons, a couple of w are attached to a large toy kangaroo dressed in a white s wearing a stethoscope.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (laughing herself) - well you got it. I’ve walked into a jungle!..no it’s nicely extravagant, but really I can’t I’m a doctor -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - and I’m a patient. You have to re-examine Rowdy and me to clear us. Come up here and do it. Take you to a race -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: ~ come on! I don’t want to watch you fellas go round and round in those noisy things chasing each other like a pack of dogs on my day off -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - well how about chasing me on your day off?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - I don’t have a day off. I’ma resident. I’m on call 24 hours.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Okay, doctor, let’s suppose you had a couple of days with nothing else to do, could I interest you in the North Carolina countryside? There’s a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - speaking theoretically?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - speaking theoretically -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (realizing it for herself) ~ I suppose you could.. INT DALAND’S OFFICE Sy 166 Daland picks up the phone. COLE’S VOICE Tim, how’d you like me cleared for the Charlotte Race?

dialogues.speaker: EXT PIEDMONT AIRLINES 737, (DAY)
dialogues.text: landing at Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE AND CLAIRE, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: through Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: ~ we’d barely gotten off the phone and he rang -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What’d he say?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: ‘ - doctor, you’re going to complete your follow up work in the field. Fly to Charlotte and check those boys out.’ (she laughs) - he’s my boss, I’m stuck. Cole smiles. Claire eyes hin.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Boy, you’re quick.  Nov 20 1989. 76.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You oughta see me drive.

dialogues.speaker: EXT FIELD INFIRMARY, (DAY)
dialogues.text: at the Charlotte Motor Speedway. Claire emerges from the entrance. She’s put on a white smock and is chatting with the field doctor. Cole jogs back from a couple of drivers.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Rowdy’s not here -

dialogues.speaker: FIELD DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (checking his watch) - I told him to meet us at the infield by five. CLAIRE . Well, we should probably go ahead with Cole ~ {Cole looks startled) N ~ you do want your medical clearance?

dialogues.speaker: INT EXAMINING ROOM, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Claire places a smock on the table.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Put this on.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~- right. She leaves. He picks up the smock and it seems to fall apart - it’s one of those tissue thin paper jobs with the embarrassing split down the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on blood pressure gauge. The column is pumped higher and higher.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: is sitting bare legged on the table in his smock.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - if this were your normal blood pressure, you’d have dropped dead twenty years ago, relax will you? She stands between his legs while he remains seated on th table. She holds her hands out to either side.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - now look at my nose and tell me which finger’s moving ~

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - little finger, index finger, both fingers - Her face is maddeningly close. Cole is having a hard time He starts to drift closer to her. Claire extends two fing on-her right hand:

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Squeeze. Cole squeezes. She extends two fingers on her left hand.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Squeeze. He squeezes.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE USES THE REFLEX HAMMER
dialogues.text: on Cole’s knees, arms, ankles. He watches her tap by tap, reflex by reflex, as she methodically goes over his body. He’s beginning to perspire. Claire’s manner, if anything, seems more detached, more clinical. It begins to annoy Co

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Cole stands before Claire and touches his nose with his l hand. She touches her nose with her right hand. He touche his nose with his right hand. The exam becomes - a Kabuki dance, semaphore signalling, courtship dance, children Playing Simon says. CLAIRE (& CLAIRE’S VOICE) Hands out - clpse your eyes - palms up - open your eyes - follow my finger - stand with your feet together and close your eyes, walk with one foot in front of the other - back on the table -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Back on the table?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Yes, back on the table - Cole's anger is growing. He gets back on the table.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: This is tough -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Examinations always are -  Nov 20 1989. 78.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’m looking you over and I might not like what I see, that has to worry you - She turns off the light in the room, switches on the opthalmoscope. The white pinpoint flits around the room.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Pick a spot on the wall and look at it. Cole does. Claire moves to him in the darkened room until they’re literally eye to eye. She looks through the opthalmoscope.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (a little testy) Please don’t move!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I didn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - your eyes - just focus on one spot. She looks again.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: ~- the retina -

dialogues.speaker: ECU RETINA
dialogues.text: and its lush network of arteries and veins.

dialogues.speaker: COLE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: What’s it look like?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: ~- pink, pulsating, very pretty actually -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their faces move inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Seen enough?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Just about.  Nov 20 1989. 79. She takes a part of the opthalmoscope and runs it across bottem of Cole’s foot. Cole jumps.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What’d you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: ~ thought you might like it, it’s - Cole grabs Claire and kisses her. She doesn’t move and doesn’t respond. Cole releases her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (going on) - the Babinsky sign - She runs the opthalmoscope over the bottom of his foot ag His toe automatically points down.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - if the toe goes up, you’re in trouble - you’re fine. Put on your clothes - She turns on the wall switch and goes out the door. Cole sags, shakes his head. He does not look fine.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HALLWAY 171
dialogues.text: Claire leans against the wall, waiting. It’s grown darker and quieter. Cole emerges. They walk side by side down th hall, Cole ashen:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~ look I’m sorry, it drove me nuts in there. How could you ignore me like that? They round the corner. She turns to Cole and pins him against the wall. She kisses him every bit as forcefully he'd kissed her. Cole is shocked. The two of them slide down the wall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - I wasn’t ignoring you.. I gave you a very thorough physical - After a moment the two kiss again - very slowly. CLAIRE’S LEG - INT. HOTEL ROOM 172 long and shapely lies on top of the covers. A neat row of ‘Sweet & Low’ packs line her leg above and below the knee COLE’S VOICE ~ they did scientific studies on this - :  Nov 20 1989, 80.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (laughing) On what?

dialogues.speaker: INT HOTEL ROOM, (MORNING)
dialogues.text: Claire herself lies under the covers sipping coffee, room service tray and morning papers nearby. Cole in a towel s cross-legged on the bed hovering over Claire’s exposed le

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Drafting - He moves the ‘Sweet & Low’ packs as cars up her leg:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - when one car tucks in behind another two cars go faster than one can by itself. What they do is divide the air resistance . between them, now here is where it gets complicated... (he moves a ‘Sweet & Low’ pack higher on her thigh) - the lead car has to floor it to hit 200 miles an hour, but the car tucked in behind - (takes the second pack placing it right behind the first) ~ doesn’t. It can go just as fast and still have power in reserve so when these two cars come off the last turn - (moving packs still higher on her thigh) - the car in back can move out of the draft and beat the lead car to the finish line... The ‘Sweet & Low’ pack is brought up short by the sheet w covers that point where Claire’s thigh meets her groin. S thoughtfully regards the racing manoeuvers on her leg.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: »..very interesting... She suddenly bends her leg at the knee. The ‘Sweet & Low’ packs go flying. The gesture and her breathtaking leg hav the impact of a multi-car crash on Cole. Staring at her l

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - I’m never gonna live long enough - (he jumps on Claire, kissing her) - to do this enough -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: ~ is there anything else you ever wanted to do besides race? This momentarily puzzles Cole.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - wouldn’t know. I left school when I was 16. I found out [I could make a living at racing about the same time I found out I had to make a living -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - maybe you cught to go back to school - (Cole gives her a look) - wellit is dangerous and you’re just running around in circles. (Cole laughs) - what do you love so much about it? A long moment. Then very softly:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ~ the speed..I want to control it, I want to know it’s not just dumb luck. I want to know that I can control something that, that’s..

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - out of control. With a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - yeah. How’d you know? Claire continues to regard Cole warily.

dialogues.speaker: EXT COUNTRYSIDE, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Cole with Claire hanging onto his waist tools down the ro on his motorcycle. He’s moving at a leisurely pace, there are meadows and woods and pastures, picturesque barns and little towns that pass in the blink of an eye. Cole turns off the road and into a hollow. Disappears.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE HOLLOW
dialogues.text: men are at work baling hay. One of them turns and scowls when he hears the motorcycle. It is Rowdy. The scowl disappears. What replaces it almost passes for a smile. Cole and Claire ride into SHOT. Rowdy helps Claire off the bike.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: I’m surprised at a sensible gal like you Dec, this guy can’t hardly drive to dinner without crashin’ everything on the road -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What’s he talking about? Cole glares at Rowdy.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: (backtracking hastily) - naa, just seems every time we get around each other he runs into somethin’ - he’s done it at least eight times in ten races -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Claire - you gotta know he’s lying. The man can’t count past five.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Y¥’all got a few minutes? I/11 show you around.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (as they’re walking) - we're here to see you - this is a house call, you didn’t show up for your physical - This brings Rowdy up short.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Damn, I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You forgot?

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: You worried about me?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Of course he is. Rowdy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Now doc, if you didn’t look the way you do, I’d swear Cole got you up here just to make sure he gets back in his race car before that new driver, Russ Wheeler, takes it away from him - Cole holds up his thumb. 82.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Jump and I’11 catch you, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: He did run good the other day, you gotta admit - Come on there’s Loretta and the kids, you can help em feed the fish. We got piranhas down there -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - sure you do - Rowdy points at a pond beneath where a young woman holdin baby waves. As they walk down the hill:

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Funny thing about that Cole, I grew up and I hated farming, all I wanted was to work on race cars, then I got to racin’ - run into Loretta - (who hugs him) - and now what I want is to. make * enough money so I can work on a farm!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: {to Loretta) Very nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, howdy Cole - The older children are feeding the fish, background. Rowd checks out his baby, kissing it and making noises. Claire near the edge of the pond.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: - don’t get within a foot of the water, doc, them piranha can get out, jump up on the bank -

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: {to Claire) - them’re catfish -

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: ~ I seen ’em drag a goat in one day -

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: Rowdy you quit that -

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Hey you oughta see them birds come flyin’ in the lake trying to catch fish, first thing you know they’re short legged -

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: Rowdy! Rowdy laughs, as does everyone else. Claire throws her ar around Cole’s waist. The two couples amble along the pond side by side. Catfish skitter in the water. The sun throw lengthening shadows on the meadow. Cricket sounds are in air.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: _. (very happy) - it is beautiful - There’s a splash. Claire and Cole look to see Rowdy has actually tripped and nearly fallen into the pond.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: {a little sheepish) - sorry honey, if I’m not ona racetrack I don’t always pay attention to where I’m goin’ -

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: Well, Rowdy, it’s easier ona racetrack, all you gotta do is keep turnin’ left.

dialogues.speaker: EXT LAKE NORMAN, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Rowdy’s kids skim and buck across the water on sea dcoo’s (they look like sea-going motorcycles), racin’ and runnin around in circles. Rowdy meanwhile propels his sleek scarab across the lake seventy miles an hour - with Claire, Loretta, and Cole on board. They pass other speeding boats and water-skiers. Claire says something to Rowdy.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: (above the engine roar) ~ yep one way or another, we’re always chasin’ after speed -

dialogues.speaker: EXT LAKE, (TWILIGHT)
dialogues.text: Mists are beginning to rise. Rowdy is puttering along, barely above an idle as he points out places along the shoreline:

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: - that there’s our home on the lake, just beyond, top of that knoll we’re gonna build our permanent home. [I got an option on eight more acres that‘ll block it off from the highway -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - cost much to build up there?

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: About ten million dollars, Loretta‘s doin’ the buildin’ - As usual he’s teasing. Then, proudly:

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: ~ she’s designin’ the house.

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: We just want a place where no one’s ever lived but us, idn’t that right - She breaks off when she sees Rowdy’s face. He's suddenly pale and clammy and his eyelids are fluttering. He presse his hands to his temples, like he’s trying to squash his head.

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: - baby, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: (reeling) - think I’m seasick -

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA
dialogues.text: Rowdy you never been seasick in your life - Rowdy passes out. His head hits the gunwhale before Loret can catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jan 4 1990 - 86. ECU ROWDY’S RETINA The network of veins are distended and throbbing, the pas pinks and light hues of Cole’s eye replaced by livid and stormy ones. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Claire pulls away from Rowdy’s eye and turns off the opthaimoscope. Rowdy sits on the pool table - the room is full of sports equipment and Rowdy’s racing trophies.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (quietly) You didn’t forget about the physical, did you? Rowdy smirks and shrugs, a gesture both defiant and pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: - nobody in my family goes to a doctor unless they’re dyin’ - just . cos you ain’t feelin’ good, shit -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - all right, stand with you’re feet together and close you eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in a doorway between door and living reom, watching the d reprise of his own examination, appalled.

dialogues.speaker: WITH CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Rowdy promptly topples to his left. Claire catches him. Rowdy’s tongue is protruding, a little saliva runs down his chin. As he straightens up and wipes away the saliva, his hands are trembling:

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - we’ve got to get you back to Daytona for an interval assessment. Bill Wilhaire, head of neurosurgery is my boss and he’s as good as - a toilet flushes. Rowdy looks o.s. Claire follows his gaze:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: emerges from the bathroom looking deathly pale. Rowdy points to Cole. 179

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + tee ee

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: - you get sick in there? (a triumphant smile, to Claire) How about that? He got sick. You are one hell of a candy ass, Cole. I faint and you throw up.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Rowdy! it’s imperative you get to Daytona Memorial and see Dr. Wilhaire. I can’t be responsible for what happens if you’re not seen right away.. oe ee eS

dialogues.speaker: BOB JENKINS
dialogues.text: - I’m Bob Jenkins and welcome to Speedweek - Tim Daland the city Chervolet dealer with the uncanny eye for racing talent will take the unusual step of running a second car, He has attracted another major sponsor in Hardee’s, his new driver will be Russ Wheeler who stood in so impressively for Cole Trickle after his Daytona crash, and his new crew chief, Waddell Slutes, idle now since Rowdy Burns has been unable to come back from that same Daytona crash. SHOTS of Cole and Harry and Daland celebrating past trium in victory lane, of Wheeler getting out of the Trickle ca and being congratulated. Jarrett interviewing Waddell and Wheeler and Daland who are gathered around a spanking new Hardee/Chevrolet Lumina.

dialogues.speaker: REACTION COLE AND HARRY
dialogues.text: at Harry’s garage. Cole is on the phone, Harry has been supervising work on the car. Both are watching the set.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (into phone) - hey, he won’t return my calls either.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Well somebody better talk him into coming down here. He’s almost certainly hemorrhaging, the longer he ignores it the more damage’1l be done to his brain -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (acutely uncomfortable) He doesn’t want to see me!..as long as nobody looks at him again, he can call it just a headache..

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Listen to that horseshit - Cole glances back to the screen. Daland is talking in response to a Ned Jarrett question.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: ~ of course I believe it’s possible to maintain the integrity and independence of these two race teams or I wouldn’t do it, Ned.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: ~ he’s your friend, Cole -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: We've spent most of our friendship trying to knock each other off, we’re not that close!..I’m sorry, honey I’11 do what I - There’s a click. She’s obviously hung up on him. Cole stares at Russ Wheeler on the t.v.

dialogues.speaker: RUSS
dialogues.text: I am as big a fan as ever of Cole Trickle’s, no driver’s accomplished so much in such a short time and - (turning to CAMERA) I‘’ll continue to root for you, Cole in every race to come on in in second place -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (disgusted, to the set) Who/1l you be rootin’ for come Sunday, Tim? (to Cole) I don’t like this. If we’re not real careful they’re gonna form a coop against us.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: The word is coup, Harry. (looks at Harry) coo - not everything involves cars, you know. Cole turns back te the set and flips the channel, leaving Harry more than a little surprised. He waits for more but Cole is glued to the set. He’s flipped to a Barbary Coast movie, set in a lush gambling establishment. The croupier a roulette wheel urges everyone to place their bets, then spins the white ball. It goes round and round in its groo on the slowly spinning wheel like a car around a track. C is captured by the image, watching intently as camera mov in on the wheel and the spinning ball and the voice, ‘rou and round she goes and where she stops - ’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. 89. fascinated. CROUPIER’S VOICE - nobody knows..

dialogues.speaker: EXT RACE TRACK, (DAY)
dialogues.text: The Cole Trickle car speeds along the oval. There are no other cars immediately in sight. COLE’S VOICE - these new tires are terrible, you shoulda put on scuffs - HARRY’S VOICE You’re doin’ good, Cole, you’re a straightaway ahead of everybody else - COLE’S VOICE - feels like I’m gonna spin out - HARRY IN THE PITS “ = PITS shakes his head. He doesn’t like what he’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: RUSS WHEELER
dialogues.text: _in his car breaks through the pack. HARRY’S VOICE - Wheeler’s got by the nine car, he’s comin’ up on your inside..° INT COLE’S CAR REAR MIRROR He looks and spots Wheeler’s car filling the frame. HARRY’S VOICE - if he wants past, let him go. It’s too early in the race to fight for it...

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - sure. If he wants past, let him go - There’s just enough room on the inside for Wheeler to squeeze through. He starts. Cole closes it just a hair. Wheeler scrapes up nearly even but can’t quite get throug Cole inches back ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and Russ Wheeler are side-by-side, running wheel to wheel. 182 183 184 185 186

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. : 90. NED JARRETT V.O. - this is one of those gruelling door-handle to door~handle lap after lap duels that neither driver seems able to win. Trickle gets ahead in the turns and Wheeler catches up on the straightaway -

dialogues.speaker: BENNY PARSONS
dialogues.text: - doesn’t make a bit of sense to me, Ned. To fight like this with three hundred laps to go - it’s the kind of duel that nobody wins ~ Harry spits into the radio:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - you ease up right now, hear? What the hell’s wrong with you? INT CAR COLE ‘ 187 in a sweat. He’s blinking and shaking his head. Mute and distort sound. Wheeler’s car seems about to break through Cole’s passenger window. The wall looms up ahead. Harry’s voice coming through the radio sounds like gibberish. Col can’t stand it. He pops in the clutch and floors it.

dialogues.speaker: THE TACHOMETER .
dialogues.text: zooms into and through the redline.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE PARTS
dialogues.text: burst and whine, oil spews and hits the road.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PITS 188
dialogues.text: Harry hurries up to Cole who limps in with his smoking machine.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - what happened?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - the engine blew -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (obviously) - how?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - ifm not a fucking mechanic, Harry! Cole storms out of the pits.

dialogues.speaker: REACTION DALAND
dialogues.text: lowering binoculars, looking grim. NED JARRETT V.0O. - well that’s the third time in as many weeks the Cole Trickle car is not going to finish a race, awful lot of bad luck, Benny Parsons -

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR HARRY
dialogues.text: pushes a button on the tachometer. The readout shows the red-lined at 10,200 rpm. Harry quickly pushes another but and erases the read-out.

dialogues.speaker: INT SUPER FLO SEMI TRUCK SITTING AREA, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Cole is on the phone still in his racing suit. He’s surrounded by crew members changing into street clothes.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (into phone} ‘ - yeah well I’m in Georgia today and he’s in North Carolina, Claire.. (more softly) +»Z need to see you too..

dialogues.speaker: REACTION HARRY
dialogues.text: outside the doorway, watching.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (heading. into room) Cole in there? Harry stops him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He could use a little privacy.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (worried) What’s wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He’s on the phone. Several crew members come out of the sitting room. Obviou Cole’s phone conversation is not completely private.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (angry) | I’m not gonna repeat the question, Harry. What’s wrong with him? 189 190 191

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nothin’. It was the engine - crawled up.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Last week it was the chassis -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’1l1 tell you what’s wrong in this deal It’s you, Tim. You are a victim of your own goddam creation - (right into him) Two race teams. That’s one too Many roosters in the hen house.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: Doedn’t seem to bother Russ Wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hell no. Ever since that Daytona crash Cole’s been called a \. troublemaker, Wheeler figures he can bump and bam Cole all he wants.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: I don’t see Russ doing anything like that:"- NASCAR don’t see Russ doing anything like that.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: oh, then I guess it ain’t happening. Not under the watchful eyes of experts like you and NASCAR.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (furious) I’11 tell you what is happening. Cole’s not runnin’ good, he’s not lookin’ good - and now he’s got sponsor trouble.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: {just as angry) But you don’t, is that it? Daland has gone further than he intended.

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: - as far as that goes, no I don’t. But I want to keep the sponsor and Cole - he’s the one that really made this happen for us, and I haven’t forgotten, Harry - Daland turns abruptly and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. 93. Harry looks back in on Cole who is simply sitting and sta at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (tentatively) You were on with the doc? (Cole nods) - fightin’?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (miserable) I’m not. She says she’s too busy to see me. She probably is. Face it, she’s a serious person. She’s got a serious job - Cole abruptly rises and walks out of the sitting room, leaving Harry staring at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT RACE TRACK, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Claire Lewicki is being driven through the arriving crowd in all their astonishing variety and number. ‘

dialogues.speaker: BOB JENKINS V.0O. -
dialogues.text: - once again, welcome to Winston Cup racing and the Atlanta Journal 500, the last race of the year and one that will see the crowning of this year’s Winston Cup Champion -

dialogues.speaker: EXT PIT LANE, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Buck Bretherton leads Claire who is now pinned with all h pit roa@ credentials, to Harry by the truck.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ~ thanks for comin’ doc, Cole’s been waitin’ on you all day -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Driver’s meetin’. He walks Claire toward the roof of an open building where Cole and the other drivers are getting their last minute instructions. Cole appears tense as he listens, Russ Whee makes a point of yawning where Cole can catch it, see Whe pointedly stretching and relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Has Cole seen Rowdy yet?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (whispering) - it’s like I tele you on the Phone, Cole’s no different from these other guys. They don’t like to be reminded what can happen to ‘em in a race car. (quietly pointing) - see that fellow? His daddy Buddy Bretherton was the king of stock cars. Hero to these drivers. He was also the only driver at his funeral. You get a driver to a funeral before he’s actually dead and you’ve made history, doc =<

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: - we’re not talking about a funeral, if anything we/re talking about preventing one -

dialogues.speaker: NASCAR OFFICIAL N
dialogues.text: {finishing up) -potential sponsors are in the stands, so let’s keep it clean - Cole has spotted Claire as the meeting breaks up. He hurr over and is so happy to see her he doesn’t quite know wha do.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Is it bad luck to kiss somebody before a race?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (regretfully) ~ yeah it is, I better handle this, Cole - Harry starts to put his arms around Claire. Cole grabs Claire and plants a big kiss on her as Harry cackles and other passing drivers shout cheers of encouragement and approval. Wheeler meanwhile sees that Cole is suddenly relaxed. He’ not thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (to both men) - this is my first race.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: We'll make it a good one.

dialogues.speaker: THE YELLOW FLAG 194
dialogues.text: is waving. Shots of the action below:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. 95. NED JARRETT V.0O. ~- we’re under caution here at the Atlanta 400 and after 392 laps the leaders are: Dale Earnhardt, Cole Trickle, Rusty Wallace, Ricky Rudd and Russ Wheeler - BENNY PARSONS V.0. Harry Hogge and his pit crew seem to have that Superflo Chevy running effortlessly for a change - NED JARRETT V.0O. ~ well it also seems Trickle’s concentrating on all 40 drivers today and not just Russ Wheeler, it does make a difference -

dialogues.speaker: EXT PIT ROAD 195
dialogues.text: Harry glances at an eager and excited Claire. He winks - it’s going good. 5 Cole ducks into pit road. Wheeler squeezes in behind him. In that no-man’s land between the track and the road Whee bumps Cole.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE 196
dialogues.text: reacts, looks through his rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR WHEELER 197
dialogues.text: waves as if to say, ‘sorry’.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PIT AREA HARRY 198
dialogues.text: has reacted to the bumping. Claire watches. Cole’s pit and Wheeler’s pit are adjacent, with Wheeler’s front of Cole’s. When Cole jets in, Wheeler pulls up in front and deliberately parks wide. When Cole tries to leave the pit his exit is blocked by t bumper of Wheeler’s car still being serviced. In a fury C has to back up but in that half-second Wheeler pulls out front of Cole as do two other drivers. Buck is beside himself.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: (in his own heavy Southern accent) - that no account red neck son-of- a-bitch - Harry glares across the pits at Daland who is with Wheele crew, Daland looks sheepish and shrugs as if to say it wa an accident.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RACE TRACK
dialogues.text: Cole is now running fifth position, behind Wheeler and others.

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT
dialogues.text: ~- a very costly pit stop for Cole Trickle, going in second and , coming out fifth with 6 laps to go -

dialogues.speaker: BENNY PARSONS
dialogues.text: - through no fault of his own, Ned, Russ Wheeler pitting wide pinned Trickle to the wall, wouldn’t you say -

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT
dialogues.text: - well nobody ever accused race car drivers of bein’ good at parallel parking, Benny Parsons - EXT TRACK ss 199 Cole threads his way back through traffic, going high on outside of Rudd, nearly scraping the wall, then diving do on the inside pinching by Wallace and Wheeler who was in third position. He draws virtually even with the leader. The crowd roars approval. Claire with Harry is exhilarated.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STRIPE 200
dialogues.text: The white flag is dropped.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE 201
dialogues.text: inches into the lead. He glances into his rear view mirro Wheeler breaks in it. Cole breaks out in an instant sweat Mute Sound. There’s a rattling that seems to fill the ent cockpit. Cole glances around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: WITH HARRY AND CLAIRE .
dialogues.text: COLE’S VOICE (panicked) - my rear bumper’s loose -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: - nobedy touched your rear bumper, Cole - COLE’S VOICE - then it’s the quarter panel something’s loose, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (deadly calm) - check your spare goggles, they’re taped to the roll cage -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (downplaying it) - sometimes when these boys run out front they start hearing things, it’s nothin’ - Claire’s not altogether reassured.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE 203
dialogues.text: has found the flapping goggles to his huge relief. He’s about to say something when he sees Wheeler very large in rear view mirror. Wheeler barely touches Cole’s bumper on the last. turn. Cole reacts, jerks the wheel too sharply, and spins. He g into the wall and comes off it with two flat tires - just couple of hundred yards from the finish.

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT
dialogues.text: - what a shame - BENNY PARSONS V.0. - didn’t seem like there was much contact, Ned - |

dialogues.speaker: NED JARRETT
dialogues.text: - well sometimes it doesn’t take that much, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PIT ROAD 204
dialogues.text: Claire watches Harry as he’s leapt into the adjacent pit is nose to nose with Daland:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ~ Russ Wheeler don’t deserve to win Tim, and if Nascar won’t call it low down, shit-ass racin’, you better -

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: (eyeing the two hostile crews nervously) - it was just racin’, Harry. Cole overreacted ~

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: meanwhile has made it to the pits, car smoking and two ti flat. He pekes his head threugh the webbing:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Change my tires.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: (confused) - what for? The race is over, Cole.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Change _ my tires. The crew changes Cole’s tires. He zooms back on the track Claire watches, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR WHEELER 206
dialogues.text: is in the middle of his leisurely victory lap when he loo into his rear view mirror. He screams.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: rear ends Wheeler and plows him into the wall, leaving bo cars in a tangled and smoking heap. NASCAR officials come running.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY AND DALAND
dialogues.text: turn from each other, stare at the wreck. As it dawns on him: DALAND . He’s..destroyed..both..my..cars!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You done that, you greedy used car salesman - That does it. Fist fights between the two crews break out Harry and Daland get knocked to the ground. As they’re lying side by side, trying to keep from gettin pummelled:

dialogues.speaker: DALAND
dialogues.text: - he’s fired, you’re fired, you’re all fired, you hear me? Harry trying hard to ward off blows, nods.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY RENT-A-CAR, (DAY)
dialogues.text: moving along with the leisurely flow of Sunday traffic.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR COLE AND CLAIRE, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: seat belts buckled. Both stare quietly ahead. They might have been travelling for days. They might have been toget for years. Cole spots the airport turn-cff and makes it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT ATLANTA TERMINAL 211
dialogues.text: Cole pulis up in a busy loading zone. He reaches over and opens the door for Claire.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for coming -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Where are you going from here?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Drop the rent-a-car off, catch the flight to Charlotte - He shrugs helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Would you..like me to come with you? Cole is surprised. It momentarily conceals his pleasure. A cab pulls up him. COLE ‘ Don’t you have to be at the hospital? behind them. Honks. Claire moves close to

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: We could call this a medical emergency.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (a trifle defensive) - it’s not. I mean there’s nothin’ wrong with me... The cab honks again. This brings up

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (softly) We could also..try to see Rowdy. Cole sharply.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Anything wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Of course not. I guess I’d forgotten about that.  ee See

dialogues.speaker: CLATRE
dialogues.text: (unavoidably pointed) I know.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (irritated) So it’s a medical emergency after all. Why didn’t you just say so? The cab honks three times. Without looking back Cole flip the cab driver the finger. The cab driver responds by giv Cole’s rear bumper a tap. It is a replay of Wheeler’s tap and Cole flies into a rage. He jams the car into reverse slams into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Cole!.. Before she can say anything Cole has rammed the car into forward, screeches ahead ten yards and jams it back into reverse. The cab driver’s eyes pop open. he sees it comin and peels out into traffic before Cole can hit him again. Cole takes off after him, Claire having a hard time closi her door. ‘

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Let me out of this car, Cole... (Cole doesn’t answer) - let me out of the car. Let me out or I’m getting out - Cole clips the suitcase of some poor guy who’s just taken out of his trunk. It bursts open and clothes and toilet articles go flying everywhere. This slows Cole momentaril Claire throws open the passenger door and is going to lea Cole grabs her and tries to slam the door shut, Claire fi to keep it open:

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (screaming) Let me out! Cole siams on the brakes. Claire leaps out of the car. Co tries to back up. She finds the stairs and starts to the lower level. Cole abandons the car and takes off after he

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - wait, just wait - Cole leaps the railing and drops to the ground right in f of her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Get away or I’11l call the police -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You‘’ll what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: — Ss SS SFr

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You heard me. She turns and walks away. Cole hesitates, then takes off after her. As they walk side by side:

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Okay, call the police. I’m not leaving till you talk to me. They walk a few more steps.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I’ve got nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Well I do. Claire stops on a dime. She turns to him. With deadly force:

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Okay, great. Let’s hear it. Cole tries to work his mouth but nothing comes out.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: That’s it? Fine. She turns to go again. Cole grabs her. The look she gives him makes him release her immediately.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be driving a car anywhere - not on the road, not on a race track and not in a parking lot. You are selfish and you are crazy and you are scared —- COLE . I’m not scared -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (almost shouting) You are scared to death. (then) You and Rowdy have the same sickness - it’s called denial, and it’s probably going to kill you both. She turns away and gets about ten steps. Can’t stand it a marches back.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You want to control something that’s out of control, that’s what you said to me wasn’t it? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989. 102. CLAIRE (cont’d) Well I’m going to let you in ona secret that almost everybody else in the world automatically knows - control is an illusion, you infantile egomaniac. Nobody knows what’s going to happen next - not on the freeway, not in an airplane, not inside our own bodies, and certainly not on a racetrack with 40 other infantile egomaniacs. Nobody knows and nobody controls anything - you've gotten a glimpse of that and you’re scared. You may not have the courage to race anymore. You may never have had it - Oh God, I hate you for this you son of a bitch! You've made me sound like a doctor - She spits this last out, near tears and walks away. Cole slouches back into his car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT LAUNDROMAT-DRY CLEANERS, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Cole’s bike is parked outside an establishment off the highway and on the edge of town. He slouches out of the place carrying a couple of brown paper laundry bags, spor a three day growth of beard and wearing clothes that look like he’s been in them three days. He’s a mess. He ties t laundry bags onto his bike with bungy cords, or starts to He walks over and leans on a fence at the edge of the laundromat.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW HIM 213
dialogues.text: is an abandoned football field. It’s one of those all purpose places - soccer goals as well as dilapidated goal posts sprout from a field of dirty weeds and dying grass. Two kids in beat up old cars are racin’, digging a loose with their tires from goal post to goal post, yelling at other, frammin’ and bammin’ all over the place, and havin hell of a time ~ cheered on by a couple of girls and thei buddies from the sidelines. Cole watches as the eager drivers keep going back and forth, round and round, back forth, round and round... EXT MEADOW (DAY) ‘ 214 Rowdy’s at work on a hay baling machine, back to CAMERA. He’s chewing headache tablets (the meadow is littered wit Goody’s wrappers.) Rowdy turns off the machine. He presse his hands to his temples. In the silence there’s a famili sound coming up through the hollow. Rowdy doesn’t turn toward the sound. He waits for it to reach him.

dialogues.speaker: COLE 215
dialogues.text: shuts down his motorcycle and stares at Rowdy’s back. It’ almost as if he’s afraid to see his face.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: {without turning) Hear you’re out of a job.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - yep. INT DEN ROWDY’S LAKE HOUSE (DAY) 216 Amid lengthening shadows Rowdy wanders around, chewing mo Goody’s headache powders and drinking a beer. Cole lounge on a sofa, under a row of racing trophies on a table behi it.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You’re not looking too good.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Neither are you. Rowdy smiles but it’s more of a grimace because of the pa he’s in. He pops another headache tablet.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: How many of those things you chew every day?

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Like you said I can’t count past five. What you come here for anyway? Cole pulls out a pair of airline tickets and tosses them the table next to the trophies.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Take you to the hospital. Rowdy smirks.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Drummin’ up business for your lady friend.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Can’t drive unless you go.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Ifn it’d been anybody but a damn woman doctor I’da been back on the track weeks ago -

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: (furious) Shit I’ve raced with my legs broke, my heart bruised, eyes popped outta my head like they was on springs, this’1l go away like anything else - far as I’m concerned I’m gonna live forever unless I go to some damn hospital where they take off your shoes, make you shut your eyes, and bang you're dead. Cole nods. He rises, indicates a trophy next to a rack wi golf clubs and a couple of basebali bats.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What’d you win this for? Rowdy stares. He obviously doesn’t know.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Doesn’t it say?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Yeah - it’s the Winston Cup, buddy. Well hell, that’s an easy one to forget. What’s your name or has that slipped your mind? Rowdy turns away. Cole picks a baseball bat out of the ra He slams it hard into the table. The trophies jump and Ro does too.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Okay, we can fix your head here or down there, what’s it gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: EXT DAYTONA MEMORIAL, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Claire is waiting for the two men who make their way up t steps to her.

dialogues.speaker: INT HOSPITAL COLE 218
dialogues.text: sits in a visitors’ area, mechanically glancing through t sports pages. He spots coverage of his Atlanta race and commentary on his firing, quickly turns the page. CLAIRE’S VOICE Rowdy would like to see you. She looks directly at Cole who doesn’t exactly meet her g

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: How is he?  TT SExy SS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he wants to tell you himself.

dialogues.speaker: INT HOSPITAL ROOM, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Cole comes in with Claire. Rowdy’s in bed.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Well, the doc here says I need minor brain surgery.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: That’s not exactly how I put it.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - listen, any surgery on his brain is bound to be minor. All three laugh. Then there’s an uncomfortable silence. Claire regards both men carefully. Cole won’t look at her ROWDY . Listen doc, can I talk to this guy a second?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Of course - (she touches Cole, he nearly jumps) - can I get you a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (politely) Oh no thank you anyway - Still he won’t look directly at her. She shows her disappointment, then leaves. After a moment: Cole nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: They say I busted a blood vessel in my brain...

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: - so they wanna drill a hole in my head, ha, ha, get rid of the leaky blood... (very directly) You reckon I should let ‘em, Cole? Cole is shocked. It’s clear Rowdy’s going to depend heavi on Cole’s answer.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (after a moment) - yeah.  — See SEO

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: You’d let ‘em if it was you.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I would.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Okay..then I gotta ask you to do somethin’.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Hell, name it.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Drive my car. Cole looks like he’s been smacked in the face.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What‘/re you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Daytona. s Cole moves over to Rowdy’s bedside.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - you’ve got plenty of time to get ready for Daytona, Rowdy. You don’t need me ~ Rowdy suddenly grips Cole’s arm and holds on tight. His voice is thick:

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: I ain’t too sure how I’m gonna - come outta this deal, okay!.. (releases his grip on Cole, his voice is very low) +. lost my sponsor. I got a lotta land and a lotta plans that ain’t paid for. I’m a jackass. If somethin’ happened now Loretta wouldn’t be left with a pot to pee in or a window to throw it out.. Rowdy’s eyes well up. He’s deeply ashamed and can’t look Cole. ROWDY . ».SO..a good run at Daytona, all that network t.v. shit - it’s the place to pick a sponsor back up, you know? Cole nods.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - but geez, Rowdy. There’s plenty ef other drivers. You don’t need me.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Don’t give me that mealy mouthed shit you son of a-‘bitch. You know what you are! you got balls that “big and on any given Sunday you’re liable to be the best driver on the track, me included. I want the best for my family. My money‘’s good. Don’t bullshit me, Cole. Is there some other reason I ain’t good enough for you to drive for? Cole can’t trust himself to speak. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: (fiercely) Then you’ll do it? Cole nods. Rowdy heaves a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY
dialogues.text: Shit man, you had me goin’. Now let’s get down to business. What’s your deal with Daland?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: -.oh..hell..we’ll work it out. Could you excuse me a second? EXT ROWDY’S HOSPITAL ROOM 220 Cole makes it out the door and into the wall, pressing hi forehead up against it, Claire comes up immediately.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Cole, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (his face to the wall) Nothing..he’s fine..he’s gonna do it. He’s gonna have the operation. Cole can’t quite suppress the stomach spasms.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Then what’s wrong?.. (she continues to stare at him and starts to become unglued herself) - please look at me...I’m sorry..I’m sorry for everything I said to you,:it was awful..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nov 20 1989, 108. Cole turns to her. His face is tear streaked.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It was accurate.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Would you kiss me?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (very quietly) No.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (near tears herself) What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: - nothin’. Nothin’. nothin’.. tell Rowdy I’11 call him.. He hurries down the hospital corridor and out of sight, leaving Claire standing there helpless and confused and thoroughly miserable. Then it strikes her. She turns slow and gazes at the door leading to Rowdy’s room. ~

dialogues.text: (turns back, slowly) :-you sound like you actually learned a thing or two about race cars.

Harry’s been talking pretty fast himself. He suddenly see spent.

dialogues.text: - cos I shoulda known better than to let him drive in the first place. Cos I know race car drivers, Cole.. a driver gets his bell rung and a couple of lights flicker, or he gets rich and he’s always been poor, or he gets a family and he worries about them. He gets frightened or fat and loses what he needs more than his eyesight, more than his reflexes, more than anything in the world - he loses his need, his need. His need to drive right out there on the ragged edge.. (holds an empty Mason jar upside down) - when that’s gone, it’s gone and there ain‘’t no still where you can go to fill it up.. Buddy was a terrible pain in the ass. He thought he knew about cars which », made him twice as ignorant as you. I mean he would lay everything wrong on us, particularly when he started gettin’ scared. If he burnt up a ring because he forgot to turn on a ring cooler I didn’t say nothin’. If the brakes went out because he abused ‘em, it was my fault..but still, I look at guys like.. {he obviously means Cole as well but can’t say it) +. Buddy, I seen him do things in my race car that’s absolutely unbelievable..that really showed me what I’d done..and then you see, you’re going to automatically have to sort of love that guy whether you want to or not.. Harry breaks off. He is too emotional to continue. Cole waits a long moment.

You think } you'll hide from your bad luck . in his car? and what the hell for? For Rowdy? If he could run tomorrow he’d crash you to win the race. He’s mean. He’s no particular friend. Why?
